page.title: 12 WAINLODE 2
page.content: At the foot of the slope there is mainly unimproved meadows drained by the Colliers Brook and the Leigh Brook extending north wards towards the Coombe Hill Canal and The Leigh. Wainlode in the 1920's and 30's used to be a popular Sunday outing for young people from Cheltenham, Gloucester and Tewkesbury when cycling was popular. Crowds came to fish, swim and sunbathe on the banks of the River Severn. Now people go further afield in cars but the Red Lion is still popular in the evenings. On the west side of the river is another area f flat meadowland lying behind an embankment.
